comments:
3.2 M6

I've often had cases when the Workbench dies because a trim widget can't be shown. For example, if a plug-in which contributes a trim fails to load for some reason, then instead of ignoring the widget, the Workbench NPEs as follows. 

To reproduce, add a trim widget to a plug-in but ensure the plug-in fails to resolve at runtime (eg, missing dependency, compile errors). You'll see the following stack trace when the Workbench starts and after painting the first perspective the Workbench will quit.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.menus.WidgetProxy.fill(WidgetProxy.java:129)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.menus.TrimBarManager$STrimBuilder.renderTrim(TrimBarManager.java:395)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.menus.TrimBarManager$STrimBuilder.renderGroup(TrimBarManager.java:342)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.menus.TrimBarManager$STrimBuilder.build(TrimBarManager.java:293)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.menus.TrimBarManager.update(TrimBarManager.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.updateLayoutDataForContents(WorkbenchWindow.java:3320)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.setLayoutDataForContents(WorkbenchWindow.java:3331)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.createDefaultContents(WorkbenchWindow.java:1007)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindowConfigurer.createDefaultContents(WorkbenchWindowConfigurer.java:609)
	at org.eclipse.ui.application.WorkbenchWindowAdvisor.createWindowContents(WorkbenchWindowAdvisor.java:267)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.createContents(WorkbenchWindow.java:895)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.create(Window.java:426)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.doRestoreState(Workbench.java:2836)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.access$14(Workbench.java:2805)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$19.run(Workbench.java:1681)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runStartupWithProgress(Workbench.java:1421)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.restoreState(Workbench.java:1679)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.access$12(Workbench.java:1650)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$17.run(Workbench.java:1529)

JM, I'm prety sure that this is a dup...see Bug 135023 & Bug 136981.

I'll wait for your input before marking it as one (I want to try the plugin failing scenario which I hadn't thought of...).
